text: The 1980 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. They took place in Besançon, France in 1980.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Due to the 1980 Summer Olympics only ten events were contested, 8 for men (5 for professionals, 3 for amateurs) and 2 for women. ==Medal summary== {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Elite Events |- |Men's keirin | Danny Clark || Daniel Morelon ||Niels Fredborg |- |Men's sprint | Kōichi Nakano || Masahito Ozaki || Daniel Morelon |- | |Tony Doyle || Herman Ponsteen || Hans-Henrik Ørsted |- |Men's points race |Stan Tourné || Giovanni Mantovani || Heinz Betz |- |Men's motor-paced | Wilfried Peffgen ||René Kos || Bruno Vicino |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- |Men's points race |Gary Sutton || Viktor Manakov || Josef Kristen |- |Men's motor-paced | Gaby Minneboo || Mattheus Pronk ||Bartolome Caldentey |- |Men's tandem | Ivan Kučírek Pavel Martinek || Yvon Cloarec Franck Depine || Giorgio Rossi Floriano Finamore |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Sue Novara |Galina Tsareva |Claudia Lommatzsch |- |Women's individual pursuit |Nadezhda Kibardina |Karen Strong |Petra De Bruin |} ==Medal table== ==See also== * 1980 UCI Road World Championships ==References== Uci Track Cycling World Championships, 1980 Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International cycle races hosted by France Category:Sport in Besançon
title: 1980 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
